isis.stitle: Side Mount Cooling Package - RE Bus - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - Cooling PACKAGE

important.para: Prior to draining any coolant from the system, close two heater shut-off valves. The heater shut-off valves can be accessed through the left-side rear compartment service door.

step1.para: Unlatch and open the rear compartment service doors, left-side door, and rear door.
Locate the radiator drain valve prior to removal of the cooling package. Place tray under the radiator to collect coolant from radiator. Open drain valve and drain coolant ( Figure 4).
Place a suitable container under the hydraulic oil cooler to catch the hydraulic oil from the system.
Remove P-clips and wire ties as needed from the lower hydraulic hose ( Figure 8, Item 2).
Disconnect the lower hydraulic hose from the hydraulic pump and position lower hydraulic hose into the container for draining ( Figure 8).
With the aid of an assistant, remove eight carriage bolts and nuts from the rear bumper and rear frame mounts.
Loosen bolt and nut at right-side bumper mount bracket and slide right-side bumper mount bracket away from the bumper.
With the aid of an assistant, remove the rear bumper by pulling the right side free first.
Remove four bolts and nuts from the right bumper crossmember bracket and remove the right bumper crossmember bracket.
Remove two nuts and bolts from both sides of the body support brace and bus body.
Remove the body support brace from the bus body.
Depress the button on the engine block heater electrical connector and disconnect the engine block heater electrical connector.
Remove wire ties as needed to move the wiring out of the way.

item.para: Tag and mark hoses before removal to ensure proper installation.
Cap and plug all hoses upon removal to stop leakage and prevent contamination.

step1.para: Remove P-clips and wire ties from hydraulic hoses as needed. Reposition and secure hydraulic hoses as far to the left as possible.
Remove the pilot hose from the hydraulic reservoir ( Figure 16).
Disconnect solenoid electrical connector from the hydraulic fan drive motor ( Figure 17, Items 3 and 4).
Disconnect two hydraulic hoses from the hydraulic fan drive motor ( Figure 17, Items 3 and 5).
Remove P-clips from hydraulic hoses and relocate hoses out of the way .

figure.caption: Figure 26. Left Side of Cooling Package

step1.para: Loosen spring clamp and remove the left charge air cooler hose from the charge air cooler.
Loosen clamp and remove the upper radiator hose from the radiator.
Remove P-clips and wire ties as needed and secure the left charge air cooler hose and upper radiator hose as far away from the cooling package as possible.
Disconnect the electrical connector, remove wire ties as needed, and secure ground wiring away from the cooling package.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Right Side of Cooling Package

step1.para: Loosen spring clamp and remove the right charge air cooler hose from the charge air cooler.
Loosen clamp and remove the deaeration hose from the radiator.
Loosen clamp and remove the lower radiator hose from the radiator.
Disconnect charge air cooler hose from the turbocharger.
Remove P-clips and wire ties as needed and secure the right charge air cooler hose as far away from the cooling package as possible.
Loosen clamp and remove the coolant hose from the oil cooler.
Remove P-clips and wire ties as needed and remove the coolant tube from the vehicle.

note.para: To gain access to the cooling package mount bolts, the rear support brace on each cooling package mount bracket must be loosened. Then, two support plate bolts must be removed.

step1.para: Loosen the bottom bolt and remove the top bolt on each rear support brace.
Pivot the rear support braces to gain access to the support plate bolts under each rear support brace.
Remove two support plate bolts and nuts.
Jack the rear axle approximately 18 inches (46 cm) and support axle with jack stands.
Place a suitable jack under the cooling package mount brackets and secure the jack to the cooling package mount brackets with a strap.
Remove four mount bolts and nuts from the cooling package mount brackets.
Remove four cotter pins from two anchor pins.
Slightly raise the cooling package to release the pressure from the anchor pins.
Remove two anchor pins from the cooling package mount brackets. Discard the four cotter pins and two anchor pins. They are used for manufacturing purposes and do not need to be reinstalled.
Lower the cooling package straight down to clear the frame brackets. Using the jack, remove the cooling package out from under the vehicle.
Remove three bolts and the recirculation seal from the upper frame plate.
Remove two nuts from two support rods and the radiator frame.
Using a soft faced hammer, tap the two carriage bolts free from the radiator frame and remove two carriage bolts.
Remove two bolts and nuts from two support rods and mount brackets.
Remove two support rods from the radiator frame and mount brackets.

caution.para: Protect all open ports on the charge air cooler system during removal and installation procedures. Dirt or foreign particles in charge air cooling piping or cooling system components could cause internal damage to engine parts.

step1.para: Remove two bottom bolts, nuts, washers, and bushings from the charge air cooler and lower mount tray.
Remove two top bolts, washers, and bushings from the charge air cooler and radiator frame.
Remove the charge air cooler from the lower mount tray and remove two lower mount bushings.
Remove 12 nuts from the spider cage and radiator frame ( Figure 21, Items 1, 2, and 4).
Remove six fan bolts and washers from the radiator fan and hydraulic fan drive motor hub. Remove the radiator fan from the hydraulic fan drive motor hub.
Support the hydraulic fan drive motor and remove two bolts and nuts from the hydraulic fan drive motor and spider cage.
Remove the hydraulic fan drive motor from the spider cage.
Remove two bolts from the fan shroud and radiator frame.
Lift the fan shroud to release the lower shroud tabs and remove fan shroud.
Remove two nuts, washers, and lower bushings from the radiator and cooling package mount brackets.
With the aid of an assistant, remove the radiator from the cooling package mount brackets.
Remove two upper bushings from the cooling package mount brackets.
Remove 12 bolts from the upper frame plate and side frame plates.
Remove the upper frame plate from the side frame plates.
Remove 13 bolts from the lower frame plate, lower mount tray, and the side frame plates.
Remove the lower mount tray from the lower frame plate.
Remove four bolts from each side frame plate.
Separate and remove each side frame plate from the radiator core and lower frame plate.
Carefully lift and remove the radiator core from the lower frame plate.
Transfer ground wire, fittings, and drain valve to new replacement radiator core (if applicable).
Carefully install radiator core on the lower frame plate ( Figure 40, Items 2 and 3).
Install the two-piece side frame plates on both sides of the radiator core and lower frame plate ( Figure 40, Items 1, 2, and 3).
Install four bolts on each side frame plate ( Figure 40, Items 1 and 4). Torque bolts to 52 to 59 lbf-ft (71 to 80 N•m).
Install the lower mount tray on the lower frame plate ( Figure 39, Items 1 and 4).
Install 13 bolts on the lower frame plate, lower mount tray, and the side frame plates ( Figure 39). Torque bolts to 52 to 59 lbf-ft (71 to 80 N•m).
Install the upper frame plate on the side frame plates ( Figure 38, Items 2 and 3).
Install 12 bolts on the upper frame plate and side frame plates ( Figure 38). Torque bolts to 52 to 59 lbf-ft (71 to 80 N•m).
Align two upper bushings on the cooling package mount brackets ( Figure 37, Items 2 and 6).
With the aid of an assistant, install the radiator on the cooling package mount brackets ( Figure 37, Items 1 and 6).
Install two lower bushings, washers, and nuts on the radiator and cooling package mount brackets ( Figure 37). Torque nuts to 80 to 100 lbf-ft (108 to 136 N•m).
Install the fan shroud on the radiator frame, making certain that the lower shroud tabs engage on the radiator frame ( Figure 36, Items 1, 3, and 4).
Install two bolts on the fan shroud and radiator frame ( Figure 36, Items 1, 2, and 3). Torque bolts to 13 to 15 lbf-ft (18 to 20 N•m).
Align the hydraulic fan drive motor on the spider cage and secure with two bolts and nuts ( Figure 35). Torque nuts to 80 to 100 lbf-ft (108 to 136 N•m).
Install the radiator fan on the hydraulic fan drive motor hub and secure with six fan bolts and washers ( Figure 35, Items 2, 4, and 5). Torque nut to 30 to 38 lbf-ft (41 to 52 N•m).
Position the spider cage onto the radiator frame ( Figure 21, Items 2 and 4).
Install 12 nuts on the spider cage and radiator frame ( Figure 21, Items 1, 2, and 4). Torque bolts to 41 to 50 lbf-ft (56 to 68 N•m). Figure 18

note.para: Prior to installation of charge air cooler hoses and pipes, inspect for dirt or particles. Remove any dirt or particles.

step1.para: Install two lower mount bushings on the lower mount tray ( Figure 34, Items 5 and 7).
Position the charge air cooler on the lower mount bushings and lower mount tray ( Figure 34, Items 1, 5, and 7).
Install two top bolts, washers, and bushings on the charge air cooler and radiator frame ( Figure 34, Items 1, 2, and 3). Torque bolts to 13 to 15 lbf-ft (18 to 20 N•m).
Install two bottom bolts, nuts, washers, and bushings on the charge air cooler and lower mount tray ( Figure 34). Torque bolts to 13 to 15 lbf-ft (18 to 20 N•m).
Align two support rods on the radiator frame and mount brackets ( Figure 33, Items 2, 4, and 6).
Install two bolts and nuts on support rods and mount brackets ( Figure 33, Items 3, 4, and 5). Torque nuts to 80 to 100 lbf-ft (108 to 136 N•m).
Install two carriage bolts on the support rods at the radiator frame ( Figure 33, Items 2, 3, and 4).
Install nut on each support rod at the radiator frame ( Figure 33, Items 1, 2, and 4). Torque nuts to 80 to 100 lbf-ft (108 to 136 N•m).
Install the recirculation seal on the upper frame plate and secure with three bolts ( Figure 32). Torque bolts to 13 to 15 lbf-ft (18 to 20 N•m).
Place a suitable jack under the cooling package mount brackets and secure the jack to the cooling package mount brackets with a strap.
Raise the cooling package up and align the mount holes for the cooling package mount brackets and the frame brackets ( Figure 31).
Install four mount bolts and nuts on the cooling package mount brackets ( Figure 30, Items 3, 4, and 5). Torque bolts to 142 to 175 lbf-ft (193 to 237 N•m).
Remove jack and strap from the cooling package mount brackets.
Remove the jack stands and jack from under the rear axle.
Install two support plate bolts and nuts ( Figure 29, Items 4 and 6). Torque bolts to 80 to 100 lbf-ft (108 to 136 N•m).
Align the rear support braces, and install the top bolt and nut on each rear support ( Figure 29, Items 1, 2, and 7).
Torque all four bolts to 80 to 100 (108 to 136 N•m) on the rear support braces ( Figure 29, Items 2, 5, and 7).
Install the coolant hose on the oil cooler and secure the clamp ( Figure 28, Items 1, 3, and 4).
Install P-clips and wire ties on coolant tube as needed ( Figure 28).
Install the deaeration hose on the radiator and secure the clamp ( Figure 27, Items 3, 4, and 6).
Install the lower radiator hose on the radiator and secure the clamp ( Figure 27, Items 4, 6, and 7).
Install the right charge air cooler hose on the charge air cooler and secure the spring clamp ( Figure 27, Items 1, 2, and 5). Torque bolts to 72 lbf-in (8 N•m).
Connect charge air cooler hose to the turbocharger.
Install P-clips and wire ties as needed on the right charge air cooler hose, lower radiator hose, and the deaeration hose ( Figure 27, Items 1, 3, and 7).
Connect the electrical connector and secure ground wiring with wire ties as needed ( Figure 26, Items 7 and 8).
Install the upper radiator hose on the radiator and secure the clamp ( Figure 26, Items 2, 3, and 4).
Install the left charge air cooler hose on the charge air cooler and secure the spring clamp ( Figure 26, Items 1, 5, and 6). Torque bolts to 72 lbf-in (8 N•m).
Install P-clips and wire ties as needed to the left charge air cooler hose and upper radiator hose ( Figure 26, Items 4 and 6).

caution.para: Some hydraulic hoses and fittings in the hydraulic system are equipped with O-rings to seal the hydraulic hoses. Inspect all O-rings prior to installation and replace as needed.

note.para: Be sure to remove all caps and plugs that were installed during the removal procedures before installing hydraulic hoses.

step1.para: Connect two hydraulic hoses on the hydraulic fan drive motor. Install P-clips on the hydraulic hoses as needed ( Figure 17, Items 3 and 5).
Connect solenoid electrical connector on the hydraulic fan drive motor ( Figure 17, Items 3 and 4).
Install the pilot hose on the hydraulic reservoir ( Figure 16).
Install P-clips and wire ties on hydraulic hoses as needed ( Figure 25, Items 5 and 6).
Connect the engine block heater electrical connector. Install wire ties as needed to wiring ( Figure 25, Items 1).
Align the body support brace on the bus body ( Figure 25, Items 2 and 4).
Install two nuts and bolts on each side of the body support brace and bus body ( Figure 25). Torque bolts to 30 to 38 lbf-ft (41 to 52 N•m).
Install the right bumper crossmember bracket and secure with four bolts and nuts ( Figure 24, Items 1, 4, and 5). Torque bolts to 100 to 120 lbf-ft (136 to 163 N•m).
With the aid of an assistant, install the rear bumper by positioning the left side on the vehicle first.
Install eight carriage bolts and nuts on the rear bumper and rear frame mounts ( Figure 23). Torque carriage bolts to 45 to 65 lbf-ft (61 to 88 N•m).
Tighten bolt and nut at right side bumper mount bracket ( Figure 24, Items 1, 2, and 3). Torque bolts to 100 to 120 lbf-ft (136 to 163 N•m).
Connect the lower hydraulic hose on the hydraulic pump ( Figure 8).
Install P-clips and wire ties on the lower hydraulic hose as needed ( Figure 8, Item 2).
Fill the hydraulic system.
Fill cooling system to proper level and leak test the cooling system. Special Tool number 550500INT is recommended to fill and leak test the cooling system.

important.para: After filling the coolant system, open two heater shut-off valves and recheck the coolant level. The heater shut-off valves can be accessed through the left-side rear compartment service door.

step1.para: Close and latch the rear compartment service doors, left-side door, and rear door.
